entry.title: Buck is Never the First Choice
entry.summary:
Author: tapsandtomes

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,118Chapters: 17/?Kudos: 146

Summary: Buck takes over Eddie's lease so he can go be with Christopher - but Eddie's reaction is NOT what he expected.Buck's POV from Eddie Finds His Joyhttps://archiveofourown.org/works/64813690Spoilers for season 8 - this is based on the scene where Buck tells Eddie he is taking over his lease, and it carries on from there. When it overlaps with real scenes from the show, I try to keep it as close to the original dialogue as possible. There's some spicy bits, but this also gets pretty serious. Heavy themes of emotional abuse and trauma - especially making people feel less than or unworthy.

entry.title: I'm gonna be a dad?
entry.summary:
Author: ChildofImagination18

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,568Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Summary: Buck has finally found his family, the 118 have been there for him in every way his parents haven't. However, there is one thing that is missing from his life. He wants to be a dad, something that seems to be proving an impossible feat especially when his boyfriend really doesn't want kids.Yet a night in a bar with a childhood friend might just be the key to making that a reality, but of course this is Buck's life so of course he goes about it in a less than ideal way causing bonds to break but some to strengthen even more than they already are.

entry.title: “You were always more.”
entry.summary:
Author: XabooksX

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,379Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Eddie gets hurt in El Paso and since Buck is Christopher's legal guardian Chris ends up at Buck's place in LA (aka Eddie's old house.) When Eddie comes out of the hospital he also needs to live with Buck while he's recovering. During the time Eddie and Chris stay at Buck's house Eddie realises he's in love with Buck.Eddie already realised he is gay a while ago while he was still in El Paso, but he was too scared to admit it to anyone, especially Buck. He knows that Buck won't judge him, but he's scared his family will hear if he told anyone. So when he comes to live with Buck after the accident he can't help but feel that he can't hide his true feelings for him anymoreBuck realised his feelings for Eddie when he broke up with Tommy 6 months ago, but since he thinks that Eddie is straight he doesn't make a move. When Eddie and Chris come to live with him he realises that Eddie might not be as straight as he thought he was.

entry.title: Mail bombs and Ladder Trucks
entry.summary:
Author: Ficalicious

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,231Chapters: 5/8Kudos: 217

Summary: Bobby had tried to talk to him a dozen times already. Buck however had denied every single call.Hell Athena had called him the other day to beg him to talk to Bobby before the man drive himself into an early grave through stress.Buck had cheerfully told her that he was doing fine, and that Bobby needed to relax. There was nothing to talk about, Buck had made up his mind and he was staying on strike.So Buck wasn’t entirely surprised when, early on a Saturday morning, he opened his door to find Bobby stood there, arms crossed, a disapproving look on his face....Buck's striking in solidarity with Bobby, Bobby's planning a wedding, things are looking up.Until the mail bombs start showing up.

entry.title: let’s learn something new
entry.summary:
Author: Buddieaya

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,829Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 541

Summary: “You stuck-stuck, or… like, just emotionally stuck?”“Physically,” the man calls out, clearly mortified. “Very physically.”There’s something about his voice, an edge of familiarity that tickles at his brain and makes Eddie’s brows pull together.He knows that voice.Before Eddie can place it, Bobby steps forward, flipping on the overhead lights. “Alright,” he says calmly, surveying the room. “Let’s get to work.”And that’s when it hits Eddie.The glow of the lights reveals the man in full clarity, tousled curls, expressive face, wide blue eyes full of embarrassment, and Eddie’s stomach drops clean out of his body.“Buck?” he blurts, eyes going comically wide.Because it’s him.Christopher’s favourite YouTuber, the one with the DIY science experiments, survival tips for kids, fifteen minute long videos about how cool octopuses are.And now he is tied to a hotel bed in nothing but tight boxer briefs, his cheeks flushed a deep red, that is slowly creeping down his chest which is rising and falling fast in quiet horror.Oh. My. God.Or; Buck’s a YouTuber and the 118 save him from an embarrassing situation, and him and Eddie hit it off.

entry.title: Unsaid Bobby
entry.summary:
Author: penpen_xo

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,307Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 19

Summary: “I just…” He picked at the edge of the sheet, his voice croaky and wet, eyes prickling with heat. “I don’t know how to talk about it…about what I’m feeling. Because it feels wrong, I feel…wrong for feeling it.”Eddie shifted himself a little closer. “For feeling what?”Maybe it was the crease in his eyebrows, or the perfect strand of hair that floated over his forehead, or the bright toffee glow that radiated warmth that unraveled him, but Buck was unable to keep it inside anymore. It bubbled out of him like an overflowing glass of water, the contents having no where else to go when too much was being poured in.Buck buried his head in the pillow, tears burning more harshly into his eyes.“For feeling this destroyed about Bobby,” He choked out the words like he was dragging a serrated knife across his heart, catching on the jagged edges as he went. or months have passed since the funeral, and everyone is well into their healing journey, except Buck who is still drowning in it all...my version of a fix it fic in some ways, and how Buck dealt with Bobbys death and all the things he didn't say.

entry.title: The Last Dispatch
entry.summary:
Author: paperless_paperweight

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,087Chapters: 2/35Kudos: 6

Summary: “It’s Eddie,” came the low correction from the window, not even turning his head.Buck’s brows shot up. “Twice in one day? If ye’re not careful, Eddie, folk’ll start thinkin’ we’re friends.”Eddie finally looked back, expression unreadable but his voice dry. “Not if you keep talking.”Buck tapped a finger to his temple, then turned back to Harry. “Here’s another one for ye. What if Ashcombe didn’t just sow wild oats? What if he’s buildin’ an army? A secret army o’ bastard revolutionaries trained from birth to bring down the Empire with coded lullabies and sugarcane machetes?”Eddie blinked slowly. “You need sleep.”“I need vindication,” Buck said solemnly. “And a scone. Possibly both.”Bobby rolled his eyes and muttered to himself, “I should’ve let Chimney take this case.”

entry.title: come one, come all, it's happening again
entry.summary:
Author: buddienuts

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,614Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 46

Summary: “Buck,” she said, pulling gently to bring him back into the light, “take a breath.”But Buck didn’t want to take a breath. He didn’t want to stop. He couldn’t. If he stopped, even for a second, the thoughts would solidify and turn into vivid, grotesque paintings in his mind. Scenes he’d never unsee. A mosaic of betrayal stitched together by paranoia and heartbreak. Buck, always left behind. Buck, cursed to be alone.Buck held his breath out of spite, still as a statue fighting against all of Maddie’s attempts to bring him back from his spiral. She hadn’t exactly been doing a good job at that. He had just asked her if he was going crazy, and she didn’t say he wasn’t. Because he wasn’t was he?Or; Buck crashes out over a lipstick stain.

entry.title: best friends, ex-friends 'til the end (better off as lovers)
entry.summary:
Author: drakesword

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,253Chapters: 10/40Kudos: 25

Summary: A lot of things are gay at this school, Eddie has noticed. It’s not necessarily a new phenomenon, but back in elementary school, that word was only ever hushed, giggled over, never dared to be said in front of the teachers, in fear of being scolded.Here, however, it’s shouted down hallways, said out loud in classrooms, written on blackboards, thrown at the heads of kids who dare to express themselves in the wrong way.So yeah, no thanks. Eddie would rather not approach, or even look at anyone with something remotely close to a social life at this school again. He doesn’t want to make himself a target.Because if there is one thing people should know about him, it’s this: Eddie Diaz is not gay. Or; AU where Buck and Eddie meet in middle school and quickly become best friends. But as they grow up alongside each other, their dynamic evolves more and more into something Eddie is not quite ready to face.

entry.title: i have more than enough
entry.summary:
Author: starsandthesea

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,638Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 41

Summary: Hen tilted her head and squinted at Buck, “Are you happy?”Had he heard that right?“Am I happy?”“Yes. Answer me, I know you’re doing better, but are you happy?”“Uh… Yeah… Why?”Of course he was happy. He was 6 months into his marriage with the love of his life. Along with Christopher, they had already been functioning as a family unit for pretty much the past 10 years, but now it was official which made it all the sweeter. How could he not be happy?Or the one in which Buck gets injured on a call and has to take leave to heal. During his leave, Hen and Karen conspire to test a theory they've had for quite some time (they're right).

entry.title: Never Let Me Go ( A Sinner Like Me)
entry.summary:
Author: colescharms

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 81,137Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 179

Summary: When infamous rockstar Evan “Buck” Buckley gets injured (again), his label hires Army vet-turned-EMT Eddie Diaz to shadow him on tour. Eddie’s job is simple: keep Buck breathing. But nothing about Buck is simple—not his smile, not his secrets, and definitely not the way he starts to feel like home.Eddie’s supposed to keep Buck safe. Buck’s supposed to stay out of trouble. But somewhere between motel parking lots, midnight emergency calls, and songs that sound too much like confessions, lines blur—and hearts get caught in the wreckage.This tour might save Buck’s career. It might ruin Eddie’s life. Or maybe, if they’re lucky, it could be the start of something louder than either of them expected.

entry.title: everything in its right place
entry.summary:
Author: slugcity

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,792Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 8

Summary: Scrubbing at his eyes, he padded toward the kitchen, where he heard the clanging of pots and pans like Buck was making pancakes.“Hey, that’s kind of a messed up prank to play on a guy, you know. I like the painting, though-“ Eddie froze. Maddie was in his kitchen. Maddie was wearing some sort of robe and her hair was messy like she had just woken up and she was drinking coffee out of a mug that said “I went to L.A. and all I got was this stupid T-shirt.” Maddie was standing in his kitchen, turning to look at him incredulously. Maddie was wearing house slippers and she was at the stove, making pancakes.“Babe, what prank? Did Chris or Lena pull something?"-----------For nearly his entire life, Eddie imagined himself as a husband to a wife. She would be kind and they would have at least two kids (another on the way), a house with a foyer, and a white picket fence. He never thought too hard about the wife part, he just wanted to marry someone who understood him.It takes a near death experience and a traipse through a life that could have happened to make him realize that everything he ever imagined for himself might not be what he wants. Maybe he just wants Buck.

entry.title: You fit just right
entry.summary:
Author: obsessedwithstuffandpp

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 952Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 10

Summary: When Eddie and Chris move back home, Buck struggles with the feeling of fitting in with their family and fears overstepping. To protect their friendship and the family they've built, Buck starts to pull away—quietly distancing himself from Eddie and Chris. But the unrequired space from Buck has the Diaz boys only trying to bring him closer.
